data.name: Addiction
data.description: Your character is addicted to something. Whether that's a physical substance or a behavior like gambling, you're always looking for your next fix. If you go too long you might get snappy, depressed, or otherwise exhibit overly strong emotions. When you have a chance to get a fix you have trouble stopping and might need an ally to help.

data.name: Arrogant
data.description:
Your character doesn’t think they're the best— they knows they are. Whatever it is, few compare to their skills and they flaunt it every chance they get.

Winning just isn’t enough for your character. They must completely dominate their opponent. Anytime there is even a shadow of a doubt as to who is better, they must humiliate their opponent and prove they can snatch victory any time they wish. They are the kind of person who disarms an opponent in a duel just so they can pick the sword up and hand it back with a smirk.

Arrogant characteres always look for the “boss” in battle, attacking lesser minions only if they get in the way

data.name: Big Mouth
data.description: Loose lips sink ships, the saying goes. Your character’s mouth could drown an armada. Your character can’t keep a secret very well. They reveals plans and gives away things best kept among friends, usually at the worst possible times.

data.name: Bloodthirsty
data.description: Your character never takes prisoners if at all possible. The more gruesome death the better, and sometimes this bloodthirst leads your character to kick enemies that are already down over eliminating those still standing.

data.name: Calling Card
data.description: Your character wants to leave their mark on the world. You take that rather literally, and always leave some sort of mark wherever you've been. That can be a playing card or simply some form of symbol that is unique to you, perhaps stylized after a noble crescent or dragonmark.

data.name: Cautious
data.description: Some folks gather too much intelligence. This character personifies over-cautiousness. Your character never makes rash decisions and likes to plot things out in detail long before any action is taken.

data.name: Code of Honor
data.description: Honor is very important to your character. Your character keeps their word, won’t abuse or kill prisoners, and generally tries to operate within a sense of 'proper etiquette'.

data.name: Coward
data.description: Not everyone has ice water in their veins. Your character is squeamish at the sight of blood and gore and terrified of coming to harm.

data.name: Curious
data.description: It killed the cat, and it might kill your character as well. Curious characters are easily dragged into any adventure. They have to check out everything and always want to know what’s behind a potential mystery.

data.name: Cursed
data.description: Khorvaire is rich in magic, both good and bad. Hags, faeries, and many other creatures can place curses on unlucky children or families who cross them.

data.name: Death Wish
data.description: Your character has one last goal they want to accomplish before they die and their life is complete, and will sacrifice anything to accomplisth that goal.

data.name: Delusional
data.description: Your character believes something that is considered quite strange by everyone else. They generally keep the delusion to themself, but it impacts their choices in a measurable way.

data.name: Enemy
data.description: Someone out there hates the character and wants them dead. The power of the enemy will generally grow with the power of the character, and if the enemy is defeated then a new one will spring up.

data.name: Greedy
data.description: Your miserly character measures their worth in treasure. Your character values wealth above any other reward, and will never give up what they see as their fair share

data.name: Heroic
data.description: This noble soul never says no to a person in need. They don’t have to be happy about it, but they always comes to the rescue of those they feel can’t help themselves. They’re the first one to run into a burning building, usually agrees to hunt monsters for little or no pay, and are generally a pushover for a sob story.

data.name: Impulsive
data.description: The daredevil almost always leaps before they look. They rarely think things through before taking action.

data.name: Jealous
data.description:
Insecurity leads to envy of others’ accomplishments or being overly possessive of what this disgruntled soul feels belongs to him.

He often complains, pouts, covets others’ possessions or accolades, claims credit for another’s work, disobeys commands, and generally causes problems.

data.name: Jumpy
data.description: Your character is easily frightened and scared by loud noises and dark places.

data.name: Loyal
data.description: Your character may not be a character, but they’d give their life for their friends. This character can never leave someone behind if there’s any chance at all they could help.

data.name: Mean
data.description: This fellow is ill-tempered and disagreeable. No one really likes them, and they have trouble doing anything kind for anyone else. They must be paid for their troubles and doesn’t even accept awards graciously

data.name: Monologuer
data.description: Your character never turns down a chance to give a long speech lecturing evildoers, especially when they think the battle has been won and there's no other possible risk.

data.name: Obligation
data.description: Your character has some outside responsibility they need to fill - whether due to formal membership in an organization or feeling that there is an unpaid debt, your character is bound to a course of action.

data.name: Obsession
data.description: Your character just has to have or do something. Whether it's a very particular set of practices every morning and every evening or a long term goal they're fixated on, it's something that actively shapes their actions

data.name: Overconfident
data.description: There’s nothing out there your character can’t defeat. At least that’s what they think. They believe they can do most anything and never want to retreat from a challenge. They're not suicidal, but they certainly takes on more than common sense would suggest.

data.name: Pacifist
data.description: Your character absolutely despises violence. Pacifism means they only fights when given no other choice, and never allows the killing of prisoners or other defenseless victims. Note that undeniably evil creatures, undead, demons, and the like are fair game.

data.name: Phobia
data.description: Phobias are overwhelming and irrational fears that stay with a character for the rest of their life. Phobias shouldn’t be too obvious—everyone should be afraid of vampires, for example, so it’s not a phobia—it’s common sense. Instead, the phobia usually centers on some random element the mind focused on during whatever encounter caused such a fright. Remember, phobias are irrational fears.

data.name: Prejudiced
data.description: Whether from a bad experience or from their community, your character is prejudiced another group or race. Examples include a belief that Warforged are still objects or against another nation for their actions during the Last War

data.name: Quirk
data.description: Your character has some minor foible that is usually humorous, but can occasionally cause him trouble. A swashbuckler may always try to first slash her initials on her foes before attacking, a dwarf may brag constantly about his culture, or a snobby debutante might not eat, drink, or socialize with the lower class.

data.name: Shamed
data.description: Something haunts your character. Maybe they made a vow they didn’t keep. Maybe they were defeated in an honorable fight and ordered the death of their foe anyway for some greater principle. Maybe they aren’t actually cowardly but once ran from a battle and left others to die

data.name: Stubborn
data.description: This stubborn individual always wants their way and never admits they're wrong. Even when it’s painfully obvious they've made a mistake they try to justify it with half-truths and rationalizations, and may bring it up again much later.

data.name: Suspicious
data.description: Your character is suspicious of everyone. Their paranoia causes frequent trust issues. They might demand full payment before doing a task, want every agreement in writing, or believe even their friends are out to get them.

data.name: Temper
data.description: Your character is quick to anger when they feel slighted or wronged, and take it out on whoever's closest

data.name: Vengeful
data.description: Your character always attempts to right a wrong they feels was done to them. The type and immediacy of their vengeance varies by character, of course. Some plot and scheme for months to extract what they see as justice. Others demand immediate results.

data.name: Vow
data.description: The character has a vow of some sort. Some may have Vows to particular orders or causes, to the Hippocratic Oath, to rid the world of evil, and so on. Whatever the Vow, it only counts if it actually comes into play from time to time and causes the character some discomfort

data.name: Uncouth
data.description: Your character always finds the wrong thing to say at the right time, whether it's insults or just a general lack of grace

data.name: Vendetta
data.description: You have someone you hold a grudge against for something done to your character in the past.

data.name: Wanted
data.description: Your character has committed some crime in their past and will be arrested if discovered by the authorities. This crime could be a crime of passion or of a necessity for more characteric characters, or more cold blooded and calculated for less characteric characters. Alternatively this could be a "crime" known to authorities that the character was framed for.
